historian.constraint: Avoid changes > 5 dB in single step

proposed_changes.reasoning: Mid-point of analyst's +3 to +4 dB range, well within historian's 5 dB constraint

reasoning: Strategic synthesis balances analyst's technical recommendation with historian's risk management. The +3.5 dB power increase is conservative (70% of required 5 dB to reach target), complies with 3GPP bounds (new value -1.3 dBm is well within [-130, 46] range), and respects the historian's 5 dB single-step constraint. This staged approach allows for SINR improvement from 4.0 dB â†’ ~7.2 dB (expected 3.2 dB gain), closing ~53% of the gap to target in ROP-1. If SINR reaches 7+ dB, a follow-up +1.5 to +2 dB adjustment can be considered in ROP-2. Moderate interference levels suggest power increase will not trigger significant neighbor cell issues. Rollback threshold set at 5.5 dB to catch any unexpected SINR degradation (current 4.0 - 1.5 dB safety margin). High confidence (82%) based on 85% historical success rate for similar scenarios and conservative parameter selection.

risk_assessment.primary_risk: Insufficient SINR improvement requiring second adjustment
risk_assessment.mitigation: 3-ROP monitoring with automated follow-up if SINR < 8 dB after ROP-1
risk_assessment.secondary_risk: Marginal interference increase to neighbor cells
risk_assessment.mitigation: Monitor adjacent cell SINR; rollback if degradation > 1.5 dB detected
risk_assessment.compliance_risk: NONE - All parameters within 3GPP TS 28.552 bounds

next_steps: Guardian: Simulate change in digital twin (Lyapunov stability check)
Sentinel: Monitor for 3-ROP period with circuit breaker at 5.5 dB threshold
Architect: Prepare ROP-2 contingency (+1.5 dB follow-up) if SINR < 8 dB
Council: Re-convene after ROP-1 for performance review
